Variants

Interface Variants

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DoubleBonus

    public interface Variants
    Interface Variants represents the existing variants of Video Poker (for example, Deuces Wild, Joker's Wild or Double Bonus). The differences between them are mainly the options for winning hands and also the payback table.

    Within the scope of this project, only Double Bonus variant is implemented. However the structure of the code is intended to be extensible for other variants to be implemented.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int evaluation(Card[] hand)
      Evaluates a specific hand according to the variant on use and outups the result.
      int[] getAdvice(Card[] hand)
      Gets the advice for which cards to hold according to both the hand and the variant on use.
      int getPaytableValue(int row, int column)
      Returns the payback of a specific winning hand according to the betting value, which are dependent on the variant on use.
      String getWinHand(int i)
      Gets the winning hand with a specific index in the array of String.
      String[] getWinningHands()
      Gets a string with the available winning hands according to the variant being used.

    • Method Detail

      • getWinningHands

        String[] getWinningHands()
        Gets a string with the available winning hands according to the variant being used.
        Returns:
        array of String with the winning hands.

      • getWinHand

        String getWinHand(int i)
        Gets the winning hand with a specific index in the array of String.
        Parameters:
        i - index of the array of String that contains all options for winning hands according to the variant on use.
        Returns:
        String with a specific winning hand.

      • getPaytableValue

        int getPaytableValue(int row,
                     int column)
        Returns the payback of a specific winning hand according to the betting value, which are dependent on the variant on use.
        Parameters:
        row - index of the winning hand.
        column - index of the betting value.
        Returns:
        payback of a specific winning hand according to the betting value.

      • evaluation

        int evaluation(Card[] hand)
        Evaluates a specific hand according to the variant on use and outups the result.
        Parameters:
        hand - array of Card which corresponds to a hand of five cards .
        Returns:
        index of the winning hand in the array of String according to the variant on use. It returns -1 in case of not a winning hand.

      • getAdvice

        int[] getAdvice(Card[] hand)
        Gets the advice for which cards to hold according to both the hand and the variant on use.
        Parameters:
        hand - array of Card which corresponds to a hand of five cards .
        Returns:
        array of Integer with the indexes of what cards to hold. It has zero length in case no cards should be held.
